result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T. Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Drivers assessment if deemed appropriate.
Full compliance w/ SSTOP
Any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed appropriate.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 100 days STAYED w/ huber for work or treatment if defendant qualifies under the jail classification system. Commencing in 45 days.

supervisions.notes: With huber for work/treatment/NA & AA if defendant qualifies.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander T. Drake
